message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the design of codes for data storage systems, which is a topic that falls under the umbrella of information theory (cs.IT). The use of locally repairable codes (LRCs) is a specific technique for achieving fault tolerance in distributed storage systems, which could be classified under distributed systems (cs.DS) or distributed computing (cs.DC). The paper also discusses the trade-off between minimum distance and locality, which could be considered a topic in coding theory (cs.CC). Finally, the explicit constructions of LRCs involve combinatorial designs, which could be classified under discrete mathematics (cs.DM) or applied combinatorics (cs.SI).
